required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Heart Rate Variability in Children and Adolescents With Cystic Fibrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Resistance Training Program on Heart Rate Variability in Children and Adolescents With Cystic Fibrosis

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the effects of a resistance exercise training program on heart rate variability in a group of children and adolescents with cystic fibrosis. The study design is a randomized controlled trial.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized controlled study will be carried out in children diagnosed with cystic fibrosis aged 6 to 18 years. Individuals will be divided into two groups: control group (CON) and strength training (ST). Heart rate variability will be analyzed using KUBIOS and measured using a Suunto watch, with subjects in lying position without movements or speaking for 5 minutes. Patients in the ST group will complete an individualized guided strength program for 8 weeks (3 sessions of 60 min/week). Training prescription will be individualized and based on the 5 repetition maximum test (60-80%). Upper and lower limbs exercises will be used, including seated bench press, seated lateral row and leg press. Outcome measures will be performed at baseline and after 8 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the standard deviation of R-R intervals (SDNN) expressed in milliseconds (m/s)
primary_outcome.description: Changes in time-domain SDNN will be measured through heart rate variability assessment using a heart rate band and an Ambit 3 Sport watch. Variables will be collected during a five minute period.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the root mean square standard deviation (RMSSD) expressed in milliseconds (m/s)
primary_outcome.description: Changes in time-domain RMSSD will be measured through heart rate variability assessment using a heart rate band and an Ambit 3 Sport watch. Variables will be collected during a five minute period.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the percentage of differences between R-R intervals higher than 50 m/s (PNN50) expressed in percentage (%)
primary_outcome.description: Changes in time-domain PNN50 will be measured through heart rate variability assessment using a heart rate band and an Ambit 3 Sport watch. Variables will be collected during a five minute period.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the low frequency band (LF) expressed in normalized unites (nu)
primary_outcome.description: Changes in frequency-domain LF will be measured through heart rate variability assessment using a heart rate band and an Ambit 3 Sport watch. Variables will be collected during a five minute period.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the high frequency band (HF) expressed in normalized unites (nu)
primary_outcome.description: Changes in frequency-domain HF will be measured through heart rate variability assessment using a heart rate band and an Ambit 3 Sport watch. Variables will be collected during a five minute period.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the quotient (LF/HF) between the low frequency band (LF) and the high frequency band (HF) expressed as a ratio
primary_outcome.description: Changes in frequency-domain HF will be measured through heart rate variability assessment using a heart rate band and an Ambit 3 Sport watch. Variables will be collected during a five minute period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) expressed as z-score
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in FEV1 will be measured using spirometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the forced vital capacity (FVC) expressed as z-score
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in FVC will be measured using spirometry

arm_group.description: This group will receive routine recommendations by the pediatrician, including specific lifestyle advises.
This group will receive routine recommendations by the pediatrician, including specific lifestyle advises. In addition, a 8-week resistance exercise training program will be performed.

intervention.description: Resistance exercise program for 8 weeks, 3 times a week, with a 60 min session duration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Cystic Fibrosis
- Age between 6 and 18 years old
- Mild to moderate lung function levels
- Signature of the informed consent form by legal guardian and patient.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active smoking
- Exacerbation in the last 3 months
- Presence of gastrostomy
- Use of beta-blocker drugs
- Diagnosed heart disease
- Alterations in the locomotor system

facility.name: Escuela de Doctorado e Investigacion, Universidad Europea

responsible_party.investigator_title: Full Professor In Exercise Physiology, MD, PhD
